childMarkdownRemark.html:
Ingredients:

  • 8 ounces dried canton noodles (or any egg noodles)
  • 2 tablespoons cooking oil
  • 4 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 onion, sliced
  • 1 carrot, julienned
  • 1 small cabbage, shredded
  • 1/2 pound cooked chicken, shredded or sliced (optional)
  • 1/2 pound cooked pork, shredded or sliced (optional)
  • 1/2 cup soy sauce
  • 1/4 cup oyster sauce
  • 1 cup chicken or vegetable broth
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • Calamansi or lemon wedges for serving (optional)

Instructions:

  1. Cook the canton noodles according to the package instructions. Drain and set aside.

  2. In a large pan or wok, heat the cooking oil over medium-high heat.

  3. Saut√© the minced garlic and sliced onion until fragrant and translucent.

  4. Add the julienned carrot and shredded cabbage to the pan. Stir-fry for a few minutes until the vegetables are slightly tender.

  5. If using, add the cooked chicken and pork to the pan and mix well with the vegetables.

  6. In a small bowl, combine the soy sauce, oyster sauce, and chicken or vegetable broth. Mix well.

  7. Pour the sauce mixture into the pan with the vegetables and meat. Stir to coat everything evenly.

  8. Add the cooked canton noodles to the pan and toss them with the vegetables and sauce until well combined.

  9. Continue cooking and stirring for a few more minutes until the noodles are heated through and evenly coated with the sauce.

  10. Season with salt and pepper to taste, adjusting the flavors according to your preference.

  11. Remove from heat and transfer the Pancit Canton to a serving dish.

  12. Serve hot with calamansi or lemon wedges on the side for squeezing over the noodles, if desired.

Pancit Canton is a popular Filipino noodle dish that is hearty, flavorful, and perfect for curing hangovers. It's a great way to enjoy a satisfying meal that helps restore your energy.

Enjoy your delicious Pancit Canton and feel better soon!
